TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit IPInterfaceProperties extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides information about network interfaces that support Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) or Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class provides access to configuration and address information for network interfaces that support IPv4 or IPv6. You do not create instances of this class; they are returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterface.GetIPProperties%2A> method.
To access IPv4-specific properties, use the object returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties.GetIPv4Properties%2A> method. To access IPv6-specific properties, use the object returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties.GetIPv6Properties%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example displays address information.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfoReport#8](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfoReport/CPP/netinfo.cpp#8)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfoReport#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfoReport/CS/netinfo.cs#8)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor can be called only from classes that derive from <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property AnycastAddresses As IPAddressInformationCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the anycast IP addresses assigned to this interface.
Docs.value: An that contains the anycast addresses for this interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An anycast address identifies multiple computers. Packets sent to an anycast address are sent to one of the computers identified by the address. Anycast addressing is an IPv6 feature used to update router tables for a group of hosts.
## Examples The following code example displays the anycast addresses for the network interfaces on the local computer.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#43](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#43)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#43](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#43)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#43](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#43)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property DhcpServerAddresses As IPAddressCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the addresses of Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) servers for this interface.
Docs.value: An that contains the address information for DHCP servers, or an empty array if no servers are found.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) allows a computer to obtain a network address from a DHCP server, as opposed to using a static (fixed) network address. A DHCP server does not permanently assign addresses; instead, it temporarily uses one of a number of available addresses to the computer.
## Examples The following code example displays the DHCP address information for the network interfaces on the local computer.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#46](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#46)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#46](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#46)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#46](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#46)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property DnsAddresses As IPAddressCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the addresses of Domain Name System (DNS) servers for this interface.
Docs.value: A that contains the DNS server addresses.

remarks.format:
## Remarks DNS is a hierarchical naming system used to map host names to IP addresses.
## Examples The following code example displays the DNS addresses for the network interfaces on the local computer.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#42](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#42)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#42](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#42)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#42](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#42)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property DnsSuffix As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ DnsSuffix { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the Domain Name System (DNS) suffix associated with this interface.
Docs.value: A that contains the DNS suffix for this interface, or if there is no DNS suffix for the interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DNS suffix identifies the domain name (for example, "contoso.com") that is appended to an unqualified host name to obtain a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) suitable for a DNS name query. For example, if the local machine has "contoso.com" as its <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties.DnsSuffix%2A>, and must resolve the unqualified host name "www", the FQDN to query is "www.contoso.com".
## Examples The following code example displays the DNS suffix.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#41](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#41)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#41](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#41)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#41](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#41)]

Docs.exception: This property is not valid on computers running operating systems earlier than Windows 2000.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property GatewayAddresses As GatewayIPAddressInformationCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the IPv4 network gateway addresses for this interface.
Docs.value: An that contains the address information for network gateways, or an empty array if no gateways are found.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Gateways that implement the Internet Protocol Version 4 (IPv4) to forward packets between networks are returned by this property.
## Examples The following code example displays the gateway addresses for the network interfaces on the local computer.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#47](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#47)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#47](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#47)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#47](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#47)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPv4InterfaceProperties GetIPv4Properties() cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetIPv4Properties () As IPv4InterfaceProperties

Docs.summary: Provides Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) configuration data for this network interface.
Docs.returns: An object that contains IPv4 configuration data, or if no data is available for the interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property returns `null` for <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInterfaceType.Loopback> interfaces.
For a detailed description of the information available for an interface that supports IPv4, see the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPv4InterfaceProperties> class documentation. Note that the object returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties.GetIPv4Properties%2A> method reflects the configuration as of the time the object is created. This information is not updated dynamically.

Docs.exception: The interface does not support the IPv4 protocol.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPv6InterfaceProperties GetIPv6Properties() cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetIPv6Properties () As IPv6InterfaceProperties

Docs.summary: Provides Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) configuration data for this network interface.
Docs.returns: An object that contains IPv6 configuration data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a detailed description of the information available for an interface that supports IPv6, see the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPv6InterfaceProperties> documentation. Note that the object returned by the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.IPInterfaceProperties.GetIPv6Properties%2A> method reflects the configuration as of the time the object is created. This information is not updated dynamically.

Docs.exception: The interface does not support the IPv6 protocol.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether NetBt is configured to use DNS name resolution on this interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks DNS is a hierarchical naming system used to map host names to IP addresses.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property IsDynamicDnsEnabled As Boolean
public: abstract property bool IsDynamicDnsEnabled { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this interface is configured to automatically register its IP address information with the Domain Name System (DNS).
Docs.value: if this interface is configured to automatically register a mapping between its dynamic IP address and static domain names; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Dynamic DNS enables a client to inform the DNS servers that its dynamic IP address is mapped to its static host name.
## Examples The following code example displays the value of this property.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#41](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#41)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#41](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#41)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#41](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#41)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property MulticastAddresses As MulticastIPAddressInformationCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the multicast addresses assigned to this interface.
Docs.value: An that contains the multicast addresses for this interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A multicast address identifies multiple computers. Packets sent to a multicast address are sent to all computers identified by the address.
## Examples The following code example displays the multicast addresses for the network interfaces on the local computer.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#44](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#44)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#44](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#44)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#44](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#44)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property UnicastAddresses As UnicastIPAddressInformationCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the unicast addresses assigned to this interface.
Docs.value: An that contains the unicast addresses for this interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A unicast address identifies a single computer. Packets sent to a unicast address are sent to the computer identified by the address.
## Examples The following code example displays the unicast addresses for the network interfaces on the local computer.
[!code-cpp[NclNetInfo2#45](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CPP/networkexamples.cpp#45)] [!code-csharp[NclNetInfo2#45](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/CS/networkexamples.cs#45)] [!code-vb[NclNetInfo2#45](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLNetInfo2/VB/networkexamples.vb#45)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property WinsServersAddresses As IPAddressCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the addresses of Windows Internet Name Service (WINS) servers.
Docs.value: An that contains the address information for WINS servers, or an empty array if no servers are found.

remarks.format: ## Remarks WINS provides a distributed database for registering and querying dynamic NetBIOS names to IP address mappings.
